sentences.english: So his not-so-great grandson could get in?
sentences.chinese: 所以他的不肖的曾孙子就可以进去？

sentences.english: The unworthy son corrupted the ethics and moral standards of the family .
sentences.chinese: 不肖之子败坏了这家的门风。

sentences.english: Everybody says that my Great Way seems worthless.
sentences.chinese: 天下皆谓我道大，似不肖。

sentences.english: Thou hast kept the secret of thy paramour.
sentences.chinese: 你始终不肖泄露你的奸夫。

sentences.english: Many a good father hath but a bad son.
But all such is disobedience and rebellion.
sentences.chinese: 但此类行为统统都属忤逆不肖。

sentences.english: Throughout history, we have seen success used wrongfully in the hands of the unworthy.
sentences.chinese: 纵观历史，可见不肖之徒妄用手中的成功。

sentences.english: After he had been in prison Peter was regarded as the black sheep of the family.
sentences.chinese: 彼得坐过牢之后，被看作是家庭中的不肖子孙。

sentences.english: You see, I was the academic black sheep of my family.
sentences.chinese: 要知道，在学术上，我是家的不肖之子。

definition: father and elder brother(s)/head of the family/patriarch
numerous/common people (or populace)/born of a concubine
not knowing when to come or leave (idiom); with no sense of propriety
my late father/my ancestors/the late emperor
